### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
ADH (antidiuretic hormone) secretion is primarily regulated by blood volume and plasma osmolarity. In the case of hypovolemia, decreased blood volume activates baroreceptors, leading to stimulation of the hypothalamus and increased ADH secretion, which is consistent with the consensus (95% confidence). Conversely, hypervolemia and hypertension both result in increased blood volume and pressure, which lead to decreased ADH secretion (10% confidence each). A decrease in plasma osmolarity also results in decreased ADH secretion (10% confidence). Therefore, the only option that results in an increase in ADH secretion is hypovolemia.
